title: Disney+ Reaches Profitability Milestone with 180 Million Subscribers
introText: Disney+ has achieved profitability for the first time, reaching 180 million global subscribers. The milestone validates Disney's streaming strategy and signals a new era for the entertainment giant's direct-to-consumer business.

content.content: Disney's streaming business has turned profitable, generating $200 million in operating income during the quarter. The achievement comes five years after Disney+ launched and marks a crucial turning point for the company.
CEO credited price increases, reduced content spending, and the introduction of advertising tiers for the improved economics.
Disney+ now has 180 million subscribers globally, with the combined Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+ bundle reaching 250 million accounts. International expansion, particularly in Asia, drove recent growth.
Average revenue per user has increased 15% following price increases and ad-tier adoption.

Disney is focusing on quality over quantity, reducing the number of original series while increasing investment in tentpole releases. Star Wars, Marvel, and Pixar content continue to drive subscriber engagement.

summary: Disney+ reaches profitability with 180 million subscribers, marking a significant milestone in its streaming strategy.
